Key Match Events: The normally poor-shooting Magic scored 37 points in the opening quarter and hit 43 per cent of their three-pointers.
Raptors forward Scottie Barnes missed a dunk but still finished with 20 points.
Jakob Poeltl had 25 points for the Raptors.
Toronto was beaten 106-97 by the injury-ravaged Orlando Magic.
Post-Match Reflections: The Raptors were criticized for their lackadaisical defensive effort.
